version_description:
• You can now sort your books by date added
• Bug fixes and general improvements


Here's what's new in our latest release:

New and Improved Home Screen
You'll now find your most recently opened items on your Home screen, so you can easily jump back in to your current story. Scroll down to see other titles we've recommended for you, as well as free eBooks and our top 50 bestsellers.

Customizable Tabs
Easily find your way around the app with the tabs at the bottom of your screen. Tap to sort your books by title, author, or series, and customize your tray by choosing icons you use the most. Just tap the More icon, then Edit, then drag your preferred icon to the tray to swap it out.

Easy Access to Collections
Your personal collections now live in their own section—just tap More. If you've made a whole bunch, rearrange them to put the ones you use most at the top of your screen. Just press and hold on a collection to move it.

Better Sorting and Filtering
With our improved sorting and filtering, you can organize your books or collections the way you'd like to see them. Tap Sort to list books by author or title, hide your saved previews, show only books you haven't read yet, and more.

More Library Improvements
We've made it easier for you to see your current reading progress, and to mark an item as unread or finished directly from your Library, without needing to download it first.
Quickly go back to the top of your Library by tapping our new Back to Top button.

Resolve Issues with Books
Use our new "Repair your account" option in the Help page if you need to resolve problems with items not appearing or working properly.

• We've resolved an issue where some users' libraries were not updating with their most recent books after performing a manual sync
• You can now sort your books by date added
• Bug fixes and general improvements

Use our new "Repair your account" option in the Help page if you need to resolve problems with items not appearing or working properly.

• We've resolved a problem some users reported signing in with Google.
• We've resolved an issue where some users' libraries were not updating with their most recent books after performing a manual sync
• You can now sort your books by date added
• Bug fixes and general improvements

Here's what's new in our latest release:

New and Improved Home Screen
You'll now find your most recently opened items on your Home screen, so you can easily jump back in to your current story. Scroll down to see other titles we've recommended for you, as well as free eBooks and our top 50 bestsellers.

Easily find your way around the app with the tabs at the bottom of your screen. Tap to sort your books by title, author, or series, and customize your tray by choosing icons you use the most. Just tap the More icon, then Edit, then drag your preferred icon to the tray to swap it out.

Your personal collections now live in their own section—just tap More. If you've made a whole bunch, rearrange them to put the ones you use most at the top of your screen. Just press and hold on a collection to move it.

With our improved sorting and filtering, you can organize your books or collections the way you'd like to see them. Tap Sort to list books by author or title, hide your saved previews, show only books you haven't read yet, and more.

We've made it easier for you to see your current reading progress, and to mark an item as unread or finished directly from your Library, without needing to download it first.
Quickly go back to the top of your Library by tapping our new Back to Top button.

Resolve Issues with Books
Use our new "Repair your account" option in the Help page if you need to resolve problems with items not appearing or working properly.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• By popular demand, you can once again choose Cover View to see your library items.
• Having trouble navigating your huge library? Drag through it faster with the scrollbar on the side.
• Just like with other apps, you can now click on the tab button to return to the top of the page.
• For each item on your Books page, you can now add it directly to a collection by tapping the More Options button (three dots).
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• By popular demand, you can once again choose Cover View to see your library items.
• Having trouble navigating your huge library? Drag through it faster with the scrollbar on the side.
• Just like with other apps, you can now click on the tab button to return to the top of the page.
• For each item on your Books page, you can now add it directly to a collection by tapping the More Options button (three dots).
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• Introducing Audiobooks - You can now access both audiobooks and eBooks in one app.
• You can now see your most recently added items directly from the Home screen.
• Add up to 5 collections to your Home screen by using our new Edit Home page. Just click that big Edit button at the bottom of the Home screen.
• See how many items are in your library at the top of each page.
• You can now see the progress of each of your downloads by the file size.
• We've resolved an issue where the bookmark is not always saved if at the start of a chapter.
• We've resolved an issue where the font type cannot be changed for certain books.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

• We've resolved an issue where the font type cannot be changed for certain books.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

• We’ve resolved an issue some users reported signing in either with Google, or while on AT&T.

Here’s what’s new in our latest release:

• Enjoy comic books in our new Comic Viewer. Choose to scroll horizontally or vertically, navigate by page or in a grid view, and open your comics before they’re fully downloaded.
• You can now sort your books by volume number in the Series tab.
• We’ve resolved various audiobook playback issues.
• We’ve also resolved various layout issues on iPhone X.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

• Support for iPhone X
• We’ve resolved an issue some users reported signing in either with Google, or while on AT&T.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• You'll now see your books' volume numbers when you view items in the Series tab.
• We've resolved various audiobook playback issues.
• We’ve also fixed an issue where dictionary definitions weren’t appearing right after highlighting a word.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

• Bug fixes and general improvements.

• We've resolved various audiobook playback issues.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• We now support CarPlay for iPhones. Download the audiobooks you'd like to listen to before connecting, or else you won't see them.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

For our passionate readers who love books as much as we do, we update the Kobo Books app as often as possible to continually improve on its reliability and performance.

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• Bug fixes and general improvements.

Thanks for reading with Kobo Books!

For our passionate readers who love books as much as we do, we update the Kobo Books app as often as possible to continually improve on its reliability and performance.
Here's what's new in our latest release:

• Wishlist is now available. Add items you’re interested in to your Wishlist, which you can access from the Home screen. You can also add your Wishlist to the tabs at the bottom of your screen. Just tap the More icon, then Edit, then drag the Wishlist icon to the tray.
• If there’s a book under Recently Opened you’re no longer reading, you can now select Remove from Home. You’ll still be able to find it under Books or Audiobooks.
• We now offer support for new iPad Pro devices.
• We resolved various issues with text being cut off on smaller devices.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

Thanks for reading with Kobo Books!

Here's what's new in our latest release:

• Get notified about your latest account updates by tapping Allow when prompted. You can turn off notifications in your device settings any time.
• When choosing a book to read, you can now see its full synopsis. Just tap Read More from a book's Item Details page.
• We’ve resolved some audiobook issues related to bookmarking and playback.
• Bug fixes and general improvements.

With this update, we fixed the issue that made making highlights on iOS 13 devices difficult, along with other general improvements to keep the app running smooth.

We value your feedback, it helps us make improvements so we can offer you the very best reading experience.

Thanks for reading with Kobo Books!

With this update, we fixed the issue that made making highlights on iOS 13 devices difficult, along with other general improvements to keep the app running smooth.

We value your feedback, it helps us make improvements so we can offer you the very best reading experience.

Thanks for reading with Kobo Books!

This update brings support for Sign in with Apple. You can now use your Apple ID to sign in to Kobo. Please note, if you’re already a Kobo customer, and you use the ""Hide My Email"" option, you won’t be able to access your library.

Thanks for reading with Kobo Books!

Thanks to your feedback, we made the following improvements:

• On devices with notched display, we’re fading out the Home bar while you read, so you can focus more on your book
• When you look up a word, we’ve improved the speed the dictionary appears
